class.name: XRPositionalTracker
class.description: An instance of this object represents a device that is tracked, such as a controller or anchor point. HMDs aren't represented here as they are handled internally. As controllers are turned on and the AR/VR interface detects them, instances of this object are automatically added to this list of active tracking objects accessible through the [XRServer]. The [XRController3D] and [XRAnchor3D] both consume objects of this type and should be used in your project. The positional trackers are just under-the-hood objects that make this all work. These are mostly exposed so that GDNative-based interfaces can interact with them.

method.name: get_hand
method.description: Returns the hand holding this tracker, if known. See [enum TrackerHand] constants.

method.name: get_joy_id
method.description: If this is a controller that is being tracked, the controller will also be represented by a joystick entry with this ID.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Returns the mesh related to a controller or anchor point if one is available.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Returns the controller or anchor point's name if available.

method.name: get_tracker_id
method.description: Returns the internal tracker ID. This uniquely identifies the tracker per tracker type and matches the ID you need to specify for nodes such as the [XRController3D] and [XRAnchor3D] nodes.

method.name: get_tracks_orientation
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this device tracks orientation.

method.name: get_tracks_position
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this device tracks position.

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Returns the transform combining this device's orientation and position.

members.member: The degree to which the tracker rumbles. Ranges from [code]0.0[/code] to [code]1.0[/code] with precision [code].01[/code].
